H0.text: Weight is the property the student uses to classify several cubes into two groups based on whether each cube can float in water.

H1.text: Density is the property the student uses to classify the cubes into two groups based on whether each cube can float in water.

H2.text: Conductivity is the property the student is using to classify the cubes into two groups based on whether each cube can float in a liquid.

H3.text: Mass is the property the student uses to classify the cubes into two groups based on whether each cube can float in water.

A4.text: The understanding that different materials have different densities, and of a relationship between density, floating, and sinking must date to prehistoric times.

A5.text: Density is an intensive property in that increasing the amount of a substance does not increase its density; rather it increases its mass.
